When using MaxOSX 10.6.7 using multiple displays (in my example three displays are used), the new window command only works if the focus window is in the primary display.  If the focus window is in the secondary display then the new window command appears to work, but cannot be found.  It will appear in the "Window" menu, but is not accessible.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Open Firefox
2.  Move window to non-primary display
3.  Click option + N or click File -> New Window
4.  Poof, where did it go?

Actual Results:  
The window is not there, nor can it be accessed by clicking on it in the Window menu.

Expected Results:  
You should see the window.  It works in the primary display, but not the others (In my case three displays, so I don't know if it is a dual display issue or a tri-display issue.

comments.text: I have seen this in Firefox 4 and is still present in Firefox 5.  It doesn't seem to be specific to the primary display (ie the display the menubar is in).  I have a MacBook Pro and an external LCD.  When the external monitor is set to be the primary, I see the issue described above.  But, if I switch it to the built-in display, everything works as expected.
